div.head: 子腸先出
div.div: prior appearance of the infant’s intestine

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: prior appearance of the infant’s intestine

sense.def: Illness Sign of pan chang chan 盤腸產 , birth with a twisted intestine. Fu ren da quan liang Gynecological book. Southern Song fang era, 1237. 婦人大全良方 17: 趙都 運恭人，每臨產則子腸先出，然後產子。產子之後，其腸不收，甚以為 苦，名曰盤腸產, “Whenever the wife of the official Zhao Duyun approached the moment of delivery, the infant’s intestine appeared first , and only then did she give birth to a child. After the child was born, its intestine failed to recede. This caused her extreme suffering. It is called ‘birth with a twisted intestine’”.
